11 is the latest approved patch-set.
No files were changed between the latest approved patch-set and the submitted one.
I like this plan. It is disabled for now, but in the future, maybe in a few months, we will move to enabled by default? Later even, we remove this option.

I think you inverted. "enabled" means "don't verify", which is what I have set as the default.  I'm not sure there's any good reason to delay here.  The specification is pretty clear on what clients should do, the option is just a trap door, and I find it unlikely that anyone is going to test with this option until it's on master as a default (maybe I'm wrong here?).

WDYT

Wow, now I've confused myself....

The default that is currently set is to verify.  It can be bypassed by enabling the option.
Default changed to enabled, non-enforcing.
signed-off
Done
Are this field value case sensitive? My impression is most headers are case insensitive, is that the case for ContentType?

> My impression is most headers are case insensitive, is that the case for ContentType?

I don't believe so.  Do you have some documentation that says that these should be case insensitive?

Interesting, I've never seen them be case insensitive, but you do appear to be correct:

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types

Most implementations normalize them to lower case beforehand, and I don't know of any clients that send these in upper case, but being technically correct seems worthwhile.

I exchanged these with boost::iequals.
I have tested the change in the same way as the original patch (https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/46660) and everything's working as expected. Therefore, I'm giving +1.
Looks good. Just a minor comment on include what you use

where is optional? 
Don't you need #include <string_view>
It was in an old iteration.  Good catch.  UPdated to add string_view and remove optional.
Is it alright to have this insecure option enabled by default?  That puts it at odds with the other insecure options.
Long term, no, this is not ok, but it was discussed that we needed to message this better before we break folks.  Hopefully this is a temporary situation.
ACK.  So then the long term plan is to disable this by default after X amount of time?
Temporary as in just a few weeks?
Yep.  The hope is O(weeks), but will depend on what we find in testing.
Done
